intro: Gynoxys acostae, commonly known as the Acosta's gynoxys, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
